titleStmt.title: The morall law expounded ... that is, the long-expected, and much-desired worke of Bishop Andrewes upon the Ten commandments : being his lectures many yeares since in Pembroch-Hall Chappell, in Cambridge ... : whereunto is annexed nineteene sermons of his, upon prayer in generall, and upon the Lords prayer in particular : also seven sermons upon our Saviors tentations [sic] in the wildernesse. ...
titleStmt.author: Andrewes, Lancelot, 1555-1626.

titleStmt.title: The morall law expounded ... that is, the long-expected, and much-desired worke of Bishop Andrewes upon the Ten commandments : being his lectures many yeares since in Pembroch-Hall Chappell, in Cambridge ... : whereunto is annexed nineteene sermons of his, upon prayer in generall, and upon the Lords prayer in particular : also seven sermons upon our Saviors tentations [sic] in the wildernesse. ...
titleStmt.author: Andrewes, Lancelot, 1555-1626.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Michael Sparke, Robert Milbourne, Richard Cotes, and Andrew Crooke,

notesStmt.note: The seven temptation sermons (59 p.) have title and imprint: Seven sermons on the vvonderfull combate (for God's glory, and mans salvation) between Christ and Sathan. London : Printed by Richard Cotes, 1642. This item has been cataloged separately as Wing A3152 at reel 373:12.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
